arm_group.description: Tailored physical training and sipdrink (Protein nutridrink, 200 ml x 2)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Tailored physical training and standard nutrition.
arm_group.description: Standard physical training provided by the hospital and standard hospital nutrition

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard physical training and sip drink
arm_group.description: Standard physical training provided by the hospital and sipdrink (Nutridrink protein, 200 ml x2)

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with critical illness loose bodymass, mainly muscle. The purpose of the present
      study is to evaluate wheather tailored physical training and/or a sip drink (proteinrich)
      have effect on the six minutes walking test (6MWT), muscle strength, body weight, body
      composition and quality of life after intensive care. This is a single center randomised
      controled study comprising patients ≥45 years of age staying 5 days or more in the intensive
      care unit (ICU). The design is factorial. Inclusion takes place when the patient is leaving
      the ICU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  ICU patients ≥45 years with LOS ≥ 5days

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients < 45 years, Cerebral function that make cooperation impossible, Fractures in
             the spine, pelvis and/or lower extremities, Unable to perform the intervention LOS <
             5 days

arm_group_label: Tailored physical training and standard nutrition.
Standard physical training and sip drink

clinical_study.official_title: REHABILITATION AFTER INTENSIVE CARE What Effect Does Physiotherapy and Proteinrich Sip Drink Have on Physical Performance, Bodycomposition, Bodyweight and Quality of Life?

other_outcome.measure: Quality of life SF-36 (when leaving hospital, after 12 weeks and 12 months  Body weight (leaving the ICU, after 12 weeks, after 12 months)  Body composition (leaving the ICU, after 12 weeks, after 12 months)

primary_outcome.measure: 6 minutes walking test (6MWT) (when the patient leave hospital, 12 weeks and 12 months)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Isometric quadriceps strength, Isometrisk handgrip strength, Bodyweight Bodycomposition (Dexa)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Factorial Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
